type: presumption that "contracted COVID-19 as an occupational disease arising out of and in the course of employment"
workers_covered: employees who meet certain conditions, including employed by an employer deemed "essential" if the injury date was more 14 days after March 23, 2020

type: "conclusively" presumed
workers_covered: "firefighter, emergency medical technician, paramedic, peace officer, or health care provider"

type: suspend statutory bar on "compensation for exposure to a disease to which the general public is exposed"
suspend statutory bar on "compensation for exposure to a disease to which the general public is exposed"
COVID-19 as exception to bar on "compensation for ordinary diseases of life to which the general public is exposed"
presumption that COVID-19-related illness arises out of and in the course of the employment
presumption that positive COVID-19 test is covered occupational disease

presumption that COVID-19 exposure and contraction arose out of and in course of employment; and "causally connected to the hazards or exposures of the employee's first responder or front-line worker employment"
presumption that removal of certain types of workers by a physician is "due to occupational exposure to COVID-19"
workers_covered: E.g., first responders; corrections officers; military; active National Guard; domestic violence shelter workers; child advocacy workers; rape crisis center staff; grocery workers;  postal service workers; certain child care workers

type: presumption that "a COVID-19-response employee who is confirmed as COVID-19 positive on or after March 18, 2020, either by physician or by test" has "suffered a "'personal injury'"
presumption, if diagnosed with COVID-19, of injury arising out of in the course of employment
presumption of "occupational disease arising out of and in the course of employment"
workers_covered: first responders, certain health care workers, required child care providers for first responders and health care workers

type: presumption of occupational disease arising out of and in course of employment
workers_covered: law enforcement officer, firefighter, emergency medical technician

type: "prima facie presumption that the First Responder's COVID-19 exposure and infection were occupationally related"
extending Emergency Order 36 to National Guard
presumption that, if contract COVID-19, suffered a "compensable occupational disease"
workers_covered: certain state executive agency employee and "eligible volunteer"

type: eligibility for WC wage replacement and medical coverage for 14 days if quarantined
workers_covered: first responders; health care workers; others

type: extends E.O. 2020-12 to funeral home workers

source: HB 3007, sec. 2, codified as amended by HB5006, Utah Stat. 34A-3-202(1)
type: presumption that "contracted COVID-19 during the course of performing the first responder's duties as a first responder if the first responder is diagnosed with COVID-19" while employed or serving as a first responder or 2 weeks thereafter

presumption that "disability or death resulting from COVID-19" is "compensable" if the worker "receives a positive laboratory test for COVID-19 or a diagnosis of COVID-19 from a licensed healthcare provider between April 1, 2020 and January 15, 2021" and certain other conditions apply

presumption that "disability or death resulting from COVID-19" is "compensable" if the worker "receives a positive laboratory test for COVID-19 or a diagnosis of COVID-19 from a licensed healthcare provider between March 1, 2020 and January 15, 2021"
workers_covered: "frontline worker" - "individual with an elevated risk of exposure to COVID-19 who is employed" in certain occupations

type: "where an injury to a first responder is found to be caused by COVID-19 during the public health emergency declared by the governor . . . on March 12, 2020, by executive order 72, and ending 30 days after the termination of the order, and where the employee has been exposed to persons with confirmed cases of COVID-19 in the course of employment, the injury is presumed to be caused by the individual’s employment"

"For the period beginning January 1, 2020 through December 30, 2020, if any employee in an employment sector for which coverage is provided by this act is infected with the COVID?19 Coronavirus, it shall be presumed that the risk of contracting the illness or disease was increased by the nature of the employment"
presumption that "contraction of the disease is work-related and fully compensable"
workers_covered: health care worker, public safety worker, or other essential employee
